key_risks: Regulatory challenges and reliance on approvals from CPUC and TCEQ
Water scarcity and drought risks in drought-prone regions like California
Aging infrastructure requiring significant financial and operational investments
Public opposition to rate increases necessary for infrastructure upgrades
controversies: Rate increases leading to potential public opposition
Challenges in integrating operations post-merger with Connecticut Water Service
environmental_issues: Water scarcity and prolonged droughts impacting resource availability
Need for continuous infrastructure upgrades to ensure environmental compliance
social_issues: Public perception and community relations management due to rate hikes
Commitment to water conservation and environmental stewardship
governance_issues: Regulatory uncertainty and reliance on CPUC and TCEQ decisions
Managing financial health and rate recovery to fund infrastructure projects
